newsitem.title: INDIA: Concorde misses hop on round-the-world flight.
newsitem.headline: Concorde misses hop on round-the-world flight.

text.p: A British Airways Concorde airliner with 96 passengers on their once-in-a-lifetime trip around the world had to transfer on an Air-India Airbus on Friday after the supersonic jet needed servicing at Bombay.
"The Concorde made a normal landing. There was no problem with the engine but it developed low oil pressure in engine number three," a British Airways official at Bombay airport said.
State-run Air-India put on a special charter to fly the Concorde's passengers to Nairobi, their next stop after Delhi, the official said.
The Concorde would then pick up the passengers at Nairobi to complete the journey, he added.
